food.name: 3to
food.description: A mashed yam or plantain dish mixed with palm oil and spiced with onions and pepper, often topped with boiled eggs.

food.name: Agbeli Kaklo
food.description: Crispy deep-fried balls made from grated cassava, commonly served with coconut on the side.

food.name: Angwamo
food.description: Also called 'oil rice', this dish is made with rice cooked in oil and often served with fried eggs, sardines, or sausage.

food.name: Banku and Tilapia
food.description: Fermented corn and cassava dough balls served with spicy grilled tilapia and hot pepper sauce.

food.name: Bofrot
food.description: A popular Ghanaian doughnut — sweet, golden-brown, and fluffy on the inside.

food.name: Fufu
food.description: A starchy, stretchy dough made from cassava, yam, or plantain, traditionally pounded and served with soups.

food.name: Gari Foto
food.description: Made with soaked gari mixed into a tomato-based sauce with vegetables, often served with eggs or meat.

food.name: Groundnut Soup
food.description: Rich, creamy peanut soup usually paired with rice balls, fufu, or banku.

food.name: Hausa Koko
food.description: A spicy millet porridge typically eaten at breakfast with koose or bread.

food.name: Jollof
food.description: A beloved one-pot rice dish cooked in a tomato stew with spices, often served with chicken, beef, or fish.

food.name: Kelewele
food.description: Spiced and fried ripe plantains with a kick of ginger, cloves, and pepper.

food.name: Kenkey
food.description: Fermented corn dough wrapped in leaves and steamed, served with pepper sauce and fried fish.

food.name: Koose
food.description: Fried bean cakes seasoned with onion, pepper, and salt — often eaten with porridge.

food.name: Light Soup
food.description: A thin and spicy tomato-based soup usually served with fufu or rice balls.

food.name: Meatpie
food.description: Golden pastry pockets filled with seasoned minced meat, onions, and vegetables.

food.name: Nkatecake
food.description: A crunchy peanut brittle made by caramelizing roasted peanuts with sugar.

food.name: Okra Stew
food.description: A slimy yet savory stew made with chopped okra, palm oil, meat or fish, and seasonings.

food.name: Red Red
food.description: Fried ripe plantains served with black-eyed beans cooked in red palm oil stew.

food.name: Shito
food.description: A dark, spicy Ghanaian pepper sauce made with dried fish, shrimp, chili, and oil.

food.name: Chinchinga
food.description: A popular Ghanaian street food made with skewered beef or chicken, seasoned with savory spices and grilled to smoky perfection.

food.name: Ampesi
food.description: A traditional boiled dish made from yam, plantain, or cassava, typically served with palava sauce, kontomire stew, or garden egg stew.

food.name: Planitain chips
food.description: Thinly sliced ripe or unripe plantains deep-fried until golden and crispy—sweet or salty, always satisfying.

food.name: Tuo Zafi
food.description: A northern Ghana staple made from maize or millet, often served with green leafy soup and meat.

food.name: Waakye
food.description: A rice and beans combo cooked with millet leaves for color, often served with eggs, spaghetti, meat, and shito.

food.name: Yam and Palava Sauce
food.description: Boiled yam slices served with a spinach-based stew made with egusi (melon seeds) and fish or meat.

food.name: Yamballs
food.description: Mashed yam mixed with spices and fish, rolled into balls and deep-fried.
